attributes.action: make opticians to have free and compulsory scratchproof coating on lenses
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Scratch proof lenses costs about £10-25 per pair of glasses you order. Regardless of the material that the lenses are made of, scratches can be made fairly easily without the anti-scratch coating. Thus, this makes a paid of glasses useless. Opticians should make all of their lenses with the basic form of scratch proof coating. I have an eye condition (which the NHS don't give discount see petitions.pm.gov.uk/keratoconusfree) and that means my prescription changes three times a year. This means I have to pay an extra £45-60 a time to get my 2 pairs of glasses and 1 pair of sunglasses (condition makes my eye very photo sensitive). Getting glasses is expensive in the first place. Any help to reduce the cost will benefit all glasses wearers

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
